title: [Self-directed] Emergency Remote Teaching (ERT) Assessment Design and Improvement Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic remote education tool proficiency and elementary mathematics teaching experience
context.additional_context: Focuses on pre-service/in-service teachers evaluating and deriving improvement strategies for math classes in ERT environments through VR simulation

learning_goals: Assess the suitability of ERT lesson designs using mixed research methods (quantitative + qualitative)
Improve math lesson scenarios by applying the five core principles of ERT (simplicity, accessibility, affordability, flexibility, empathy) in simulation/VR environments
Diagnose accessibility issues arising during ERT implementation and develop resolution strategies based on student experience data

resources: ERT (Emergency Remote Teaching) Evaluation Framework Sample

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
